msgSnippet: ... If this is really an MVC application, then you should be able to set up the appropriate context and just invoke the Controller that handles the request you
messageBody:
noam_eitan wrote:

> I'm using a MVC application.
>
> I want to check the following path:
> Login - navigate to a specific JSP - ask for customer details.
>
> I want to check the customer details I got, since it depends on the
> user profile.
>
> I tried to check with "Cactus", but it looks like there isn't
> a "state", means, after login, when running the navigate step, I lost
> the prev session.
>
> I bevelive I should use diff "testXXX" (in same class), since I need
> to use diff "beginXXX".
>
> How can I check this issue ?

If this is really an MVC application, then you should be able to set up
the appropriate context and just invoke the Controller that handles the
request you really want to test. If not, then I'm not sure how much this
is an MVC application. :) (Rude, but true.)

If I were given this feature to test and I couldn't do what I describe
in the previous paragraph, I'd use HtmlUnit to write the test. I highly
recommend it. I like Cactus, but I don't know how to answer your
specific question about Cactus. One option is to read _JUnit in Action_.
Another is to hope Vince Massol is reading this group these days.
